data.title: Best of the North
data.text: Cincinnati Magazine recommended this restaurant for their "Best of the North" award - in two categories - best family dining, and best chili. They brought home both awards, and they have only been in business 1 year. Check out this charming and delicious restaurant - in the heart of downtown Hamilton, OH.

data.title: Delicious breakfast!
data.text: I was very pleased with what I ordered, an eggs benedict with turkey. They also have a great spread of baked goods. The kitchen is open so you can see the action. I am glad to see the downtown area is being developed positively and High St Cafe brings good fiood, great atmosphere and good value to the area.

data.title: Best meal in Hamilton,OH
data.text: What else can I say? I've been in this town for 36 hours and I've had 5 meals.  This was the only one worth mentioning.  I had a BLT and a cup of tomato bisque.  Simple, but delicious.

data.title: Nice lunch
data.text: Visited after the kitchen was closed and the cook was nice enough to go back and fix my daughter and myself the salmon bacon club. While waiting they offered us several samples of foods that they serve and all were great. Would give a 5 star but the kitchen closes at 2 and I probably won't be able to eat here regularly but I highly recommend this restaurant as a lunchtime destination. The salmon and bacon club sandwich was great and the chilli was great.

data.title: Tops in service and quality of food
data.text: Meet friends there frequently. Menu is unexpectedly varied. Unique specials that always delight. Prices are moderate.

data.title: Great find for Miami families
data.text: We stopped by here for brunch during family weekend at Miami of Ohio. Welcoming vibe and great food. Highly recommend. Lunch menu also looked very good.

data.title: Great spot!
data.text: Perfect spot for dining and catering! Wonderful restaurant with home made fresh food! Amish goods and hard to find items! Check it out, won't be disappointed

data.title: Busy day lunch break
data.text: Charming little restaurant in downtown Hamilton.   Great food.  Good atmosphere. Hamilton is on the upswing and this restaurant helps attract new clients.  Their food keeps customers coming back.

data.title: Very good breakfast
data.text: Loved the High St. Café. Since we were newbies, it took us a quick minute to figure it out. You order at the counter, then your food is brought to you. You ALSO get your drinks from a beverage area. No problem. I have no issues doing that, we just didn't know how it worked. Everyone was super friendly. Food was standard breakfast fare, but better!  lol! Would absolutely return here if in the area again!

data.title: Fantastic
data.text:
I have only three words for you:  Chicken Berry Salad.  

It is extremely addictive, you have been warned!

data.title: Good food....good service
data.text:
I have ate here several times and it is excellent. Best BLT around. Great for breakfast or lunch. 
All desserts are homemade.

data.title: Lucky we stopped.
data.text: Wow.   What a great place for breakfast.   Large tasty portions, great coffee, interesting venue and great people running the business.  The Breakfast Burrito was outstanding.   Really enjoyed our breakfast there earlier this week.  To think we almost went to a chain restaurant instead.

data.title: Good food. Items are made fresh
data.text: Had lunch it was wonderful! Everyone in our party had a great food experience. Was fun to have lunch and browse about "TOWN"  will be back.

data.title: Always great food and service
data.text: This café has spruced up downtown Hamilton and provides great food and service at a reasonable price.  It can get busy quickly so go early or at off-peak times.  However it is a must stop if you are in downtown Hamilton at meal time.

data.title: great breakfast, walkable to Courtyard
data.text: Wonderful little café.   Had a great breakfast there.  The menu is traditional but unique and fresh.   We walked down to the restaurant from the Courtyard.  They have a charming assortment of collectible for sale.

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
data.text: My husband and I were in Hamilton for an appointment and saw this little cafe as we were driving by.  We decided to eat lunch there and am so glad we did!  We both got the special...roast beef sandwich and it was a multitude of different tastes all delicious!  The guys working there were very nice and really knew what they were talking about when it came to putting a sandwich together!  The only downside is that this cafe is too far away for us to visit on a regular basis.

data.title: Great little place
data.text: Breakfast or lunch, the food is always good and the eclectic decor is homey and welcoming.  THye also offer a wonderful variety of baked goods to take home with you.

data.title: Business lunch
data.text: We had lunch, and both ordered the Berry Salad.  It was the best berry salad that I have ever had.  It had multiple kinds of berries, and all were fresh and juicy.  The lettuce and other ingredients also had great consistency, flavor and visual appeal.  The Berry Salad is must try.  I also got the Texas Chili.  It was good too, but not a must have.  Great customer service and atmosphere!

data.title: The best
data.text: I eat here whenever in Hamilton. I am never disappointed when I receive the best omelette this side of heaven.  The folks working here are simply the best offering the best friendly service and food.

data.title: A nice taste of Ohio
data.text:
I came here after a rather hairy court hearing across the street, needing to relax with my co-workers. This place did the job. The atmosphere hits you as soon as you walk in - comforting, welcoming, hometown. There is limited seating, and the place could be a little bit bigger, but perhaps it if was it would lose some of its charm.

The menu is extensive! It took me a few minutes to decide. You place your order at the bar and pay (the use ipads) and then your order is brought to you at the table. I ordered a ham and cheese sandwich -- delicious. Toasted with three different kinds of cheese, a gooey, spicy sauce, and a nice pile of tender, sweet ham. This was served with a choice of sides, and I ordered homestyle fries. Seasoned nicely and crispy/chewy just like I like them... and of course, a pickle.

I also had my first taste of a buckeye. Delicious! They do have other offerings for dessert, all laid out temptingly for you in the bakery case. 

The staff was super nice, attentive, and friendly. Great downtown place with a hometown feel.
